revised_title: Kinetics of Formation and Removal of Atomic Halogen Ions in Atmospheric Pressure Flames
tldr: This study investigates the formation and removal of atomic halogen ions in atmospheric pressure flames for chlorine, bromine, and iodine. The authors use mass spectrometry to analyze ion abundances and determine the rate constants for the reactions involved. The results provide insights into the processes of electron attachment and detachment in flames, which can be useful for reducing electron density in rocket exhaust plumes and improving combustion systems for electricity generation.
